definition: askew/at a crooked angle/devious/noxious/(coll.) to lie on one's side

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: 'Don't you dare go giving him any daft ideas.
sentences.chinese: 可千万不敢让他想到什么歪点子。

definition: to figure out/to work out (a solution etc)/to think up/to come up with (an idea etc)
to get smart/to resort to petty tricks
lit. to drill a hole/to take advantage of a loophole/to exploit an advantage/to seize the opportunity (esp. to do sth bad)
clever-clever/clever in trivial matters/sharp but petty-minded
a clever person may become the victim of his own ingenuity (idiom); cleverness may overreach itself/too smart for one's own good
pinyin: cong1 ming2 fan3 bei4 cong1 ming2 wu4

definition: to dig for thoughts (idiom); to search everything for an answer/to rack one's brains
to cross the sea by a trick (idiom)/to achieve one's aim by underhanded means
